name: Crowne Plaza Philadelphia West

reviews.text: Nice location ..Many may complain far from downtown but ...Ans ..no 44 bus is just outside hotel and very good frequency ...And most imp free shuttle by hotel(needs prebooking)..
reviews.title: Excellent place to stay

reviews.text: Breakfast good ..service good...room cleaning good..
reviews.title: Pefect Stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Target is just nearby so shopping no problem...outside many good hotels ..
reviews.title: Great location, but a few drawbacks

reviews.text: only bad thing is check ..inn timing . Even mentioned at time of booking at 1pm room was NOT ready ..as per checkinn desk it is 3pm ...but even if mentioning prior why cant you make room ??thats the reason for 4****..
reviews.title: Great weekend getaway

reviews.text: checked in Tue Aug 27, 2013. I checked-in with a trainee (highlights on left side) and she was very courteuos. I stayed on the women's only floor and it was perfect! At the end of the hall there is water flavored with some fruit and snacks. An indoor pool and spa. They have a 24hr fitness center. Ralph Holmes from housekeeping really made our stay! He is simply a gem. Mark at the front desk was also very helpful on this trip. Thank you to you both we will return!
reviews.title: A little rough, but just fine

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is nice, service was excellent from one lady on reception in particular. We were going to see a baseball match and she wrote out all the instructions of how to get there and back. Rooms were a good size, we didnt use the swimming pool but it looked nice. The location isn't great, the bus does run from just outside the door though, it takes around 20/30 mins to get into the centre of Philadephia. There also isn't really anywhere to eat near the hotel either except the hotel restaurant and a TGI's.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.text: The front desk staff were very kind and professional. The hotel support staff were professionally dressed and knowledgable about the area. The location was good, even though parking on the weekends is a headache due to the fact that they share the parking lot with a Friday's and a local bank.
reviews.title: Nice town, great hotel

reviews.text: We were there 3 nights, the sheets were never changed, with no option for it. Had to call each day for coffee. Someone was smoking in a neighboring bathroom. This is a no-smoking hotel.
reviews.title: Average

reviews.text: Friendly staff, there were some issues, they repaired them quickly. The front desk called to see if they were repaired.
reviews.title: Good hotel to stay just outside of Philly downtown
Great Staff
reviews.text: Nice hotel near Philadelphia downtown !!

reviews.title: Using a hospital rate at Crown Plaza
reviews.text: My wife and I traveled to Philadalphia to visit a relative in hospice care this month. Because we could not confirm how many days we might stay, the hotel made a two-day reservation with a late day check out option on the second day. The Crown Plaza offered this option and a special rate for a king room as a "hospital rate" which was a new term to us. We were very appreciative and would recommend this hotel if you need to stay on this side of Philadelphia ( it is outside of the city).

reviews.title: This is not a 3 star hotel.
reviews.text: The location of the hotel is next to a small shopping center with a Target store as the anchor and a few restaurants. There is also a Friday's in the front of the hotel's parking lot and parking seems to get tight in the evenings as the restaurant crowd competes for parking spaces.

reviews.title: Pleasantly Surprised!
reviews.text: The room was as described and we were in a "secure" wing of our floor where they provided snacks and fruit each day and the key card was needed to enter the hallway. The hotel staff seems very well trained and veterans of the property. We did not eat in the restaurant, but i did have breakfast the last morning. I arrived just as the buffet opened and have to say that the food was not great; bland eggs, salty hash browns and very under-cooked bacon.

reviews.title: Service with an attitude
reviews.text: Still, a pleasant stay in difficult circumstances and I would recommend this hotel if it fits your destination needs.

reviews.title: Friendly Staff!
reviews.text: The wife and I are not picky people but this hotel is not a 3 star by any means. This hotel is in great need of refurbishment. The rooms are dingy and feel dirty. The carpets are in bad shape and the hallway walls need redoing. This hotel is not located in the best part of the city and always had young men hanging around in the parking lot day and night. The staff were very nice and helpful. It was quiet and really not a bad place to stay if you just consider it 2 stars.

This hotel is in a very convenient location right off 76. Upon arrival I was greeted and welcomed to the property by a very friendly and attentive staff. My room was ready upon arrival and the check in process was very quick. My room was located on the eighth floor which was very quiet and offered a lounge with snacks and soft drinks. The room itself was clean and spacious although the bathroom was somewhat dated, it was still very clean and in great condition. The bed and bedding was comfortable and also well maintained. The room service meal was delivered within the time promised, the food was hot and well prepared. The menu was reasonably priced and offered many choices. The hotel has plenty of free parking available and is located near lots of restaurants and shopping.
reviews.title: Great experience!

reviews.text: This is a great property in a great location.
reviews.title: Service above and beyond

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff is so nice and helpful. I arrived quite early, much before check in time and was going to simply stow my bag but was informed since my room was ready I could go on up. I needed advice several times since I was unfamiliar with the area and the front desk and bellman always had answers and suggestions with taxi service and shuttles, etc. Also, it was very convenient that a car rental was on the premise. I am staying here again for my October visit.
reviews.title: Excellent Value Very Pleased

reviews.text: We were happily surprised and pleased with our 3 night stay. Rooms were very large, exceptionally good housekeeping, very good shower, excellent bed and pillows. There was a problem with our reservation, we needed a room near the elevator but that was not noted on our reservation so we had to change rooms. Too bad there was no safe or frig in the room, Quite close to downtown (15 min). We found it unusual that there's no place for breakfast except the hotel within 5 miles from hotel, so make sure you don't miss the 10am breakfast cuttoff (please make it 11am, for those on vacation!). Philly was a great short vacation, will certainly revisit and stay here again
reviews.title: A Little Overrated

reviews.text: Beds were comfortable, room was clean, service was very friendly and professional. I expected more for the price we paid. There was no min bar, no fridge, no microwave. Staff was so courteous they made me want to stay another night.
reviews.title: Average but reasonable

description: Welcome to the Crowne Plaza Philadelphia - City Avenue Hotel, where travelers are sure to love our great location on City Avenue off I-76 and I-676, less than 15 miles from the Philadelphia International Airport (PHL) and just four miles from downtown Philly. Our hotel near the Main Line of Philadelphia offers leisure travelers easy access to many of the city's most popular attractions. Nature lovers can enjoy the great outdoors at one of the largest parks in the country, Fairmount Park, situated just one mile from our hotel. Our Philly accommodations are also near the Liberty Bell and Independence Hall, the Manayunk Historic District, the Wachovia Center, Penn's Landing and the Philadelphia Zoo.
